definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)

sentences.english: Yes, this item is a bust of two wolf heads.
sentences.chinese: 是的，這個物件是兩個狼頭的半身像。

sentences.english: The coins bore a bust of their emperor and the date of minting.
sentences.chinese: 硬幣上常刻有其國王半身像和鑄幣日期。
艾前往早矢香的半身像。

sentences.english: A large white bust of Andropov adorns the lobby.
sentences.chinese: 大廳上樹立着他的一個大型白色半身像。

sentences.english: A half-length figure stood on the desk.
Behind Nike, the bust of Zeus on a plinth.
sentences.chinese: 後面是一尊放置在柱基上的宙斯半身像。

sentences.english: Then the museum's owner is murdered and a Bernini bust disappears.
sentences.chinese: 然後，博物館的主人是謀殺和貝爾尼尼半身像消失。

sentences.english: He took off her head and shoulders in charcoal.
sentences.chinese: 他用炭筆畫她的半身像。
穿鬆緊線在中心聚集半身像。

sentences.english: I’m not usually a fan of busts, but this one is actually pretty cool.
sentences.chinese: 我不能算是半身像的追捧者，但這一個真得非常酷。

sentences.english: Behind is placed in a column of the bust of Zeus.
sentences.chinese: 後面是一尊放置在柱基上的宙斯半身像。

sentences.english: They keep a bust of Beethovn in the School of Music.
sentences.chinese: 他們放了一座貝多芬的半身像在音樂學校。

sentences.english: It is a bust chiseled from a rock.

definition: portrait (painting, photo etc)/(in a general sense) representation of a person/likeness
seated image (of a Buddha or saint)
portrait/to do a portrait of sb
vivid and lifelike (idiom); true to life/realistic
Michelangelo Buonarroti (1475-1564), Renaissance painter and sculptor
